result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: See DAGP document for details of agreement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander B Bartle

defendant.name: Bartle, Alexander B
defendant.address: 220 E Trillium Cir, Green Bay, WI 54313

records.addlTxt: (See plea hearing docket event for details of waiver)

(Case called at 4:00 PM)
Defendant Alexander Bartle appears with Attorney Matthew Krische.  Attorney Trenton Piltz appears for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing - waiver accepted by Court.  Defense outlines agreement for the Court.  Agreement calls for an 18-month Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea (DAGP) agreement.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1: Terrorist Threats.  Defendant advised of the elements of the offense, as well as the maximum possible penalties.  Court finds the plea was knowingly and intelligently made.  Counsel make statements regarding the agreement.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court accepts the DAGP agreement and orders the Defendant comply with all conditions to include community service hours to be done at UW-Eau Claire. 
DAGP Return Hearing: January 18, 2024 at 9:30 AM
Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement - DAGP (Signed)

10:50am  Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexander B Bartle not in court.  Attorney Matthew Krische not in court. There was an agreement in this case so it was rescheduled to a plea hearing in Br. 5 on 07/18/22 at 4pm.
Plea hearing on July 18, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Conditions:
Not to use any anonymous messaging apps.

(11:00 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Alexander B Bartle in court. Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Alexander B Bartle.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on June 20, 2022 at 2:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Not to use any anonymous messaging apps.
